mathGenDecimalTooltip: Select the number of significant decimal places
mathGenDisabledTableEditTopText: This data table cannot be edited from here as the Math Question Generator has created it.
mathGenErrorGenerateEmpty: Could not generate data. Please edit your expression or Question.
mathGenErrorGenerateServerError: There"s been a problem with your request. Please try again later.
mathGenErrorValidationEmpty: Invalid expression! The criteria you have set does not return valid results. Please edit your expression or Question.
mathGenErrorValidationServerError: There"s been a problem with your request. Please try again later.
mathGenExpressionHeading: Create the expression with the parameter(s)
mathGenExpressionInstructions:
Use the keypad to create a mathematical expression that generates the answer to the Question stem.
Use the parameter dropdown selector %parameterIcon% in the keypad to insert your parameter(s).
mathGenFormValidationDataSeparatorValue: The separators for decimal and thousand positions cannot both use the %value% character
mathGenFormValidationExpressionParameter: Expression should have at least %value% parameter(s)
mathGenFormValidationParameterListFormat: The range should only contain numbers (to 3 decimal places maximum) and commas without spaces
mathGenFormValidationParameterMaxInvalid: Max value should be a valid number
mathGenFormValidationParameterMaxMaxValu: Max value should not be more than %value%
mathGenFormValidationParameterMaxMinValu: Max value should not be less than %value%
mathGenFormValidationParameterMaxPermuta: Permutations should not be more than %value%
mathGenFormValidationParameterMinInvalid: Min value should be a valid number
mathGenFormValidationParameterMinMaxValu: Min value should not be more than %value%
mathGenFormValidationParameterMinMinValu: Min value should not be less than %value%
mathGenFormValidationParameterMinPermuta: Permutations should not be less than %value%
mathGenFormValidationParameterNameMaxLen: Name should not be longer than %value% character(s)
mathGenFormValidationParameterNameMinLen: Name should have at least %value% character(s)
mathGenFormValidationParameterNamePatter: Name should only contain letters a-z or A-Z
mathGenFormValidationParameterStepInvali: Step value should be a valid number
mathGenFormValidationParameterStepMinVal: Step value should not be less than %value%
mathGenFormValidationQuestionResponseExc: Question should not contain more than %value% response(s)
mathGenFormValidationValidationDataForma: You need to select at least %value% answer format(s)
mathGenFormValidationValidationDataScore: Score should not be less than %value%
mathGenGenerateInstructions: A maximum of %possibilityCount% Questions will be returned based on your parameters and settings. After generating, you can refine the results by removing unwanted variations.
mathGenGenerateRefineInstructions: Refine the results by removing unwanted variations.
mathGenGenerateRegenerateWarning: This will overwrite existing content for this Item. Are you sure you want to continue?
mathGenIntroDescription:
Create a generated formula problem by defining your parameters and generating a set of possible Questions.
The student will see one randomly selected Question from the generated set.
mathGenIntroHeading: Create a Math Question Generator Expression
mathGenParameterListEdit: Edit parameter list using comma separated values
mathGenParametersHeading: Create parameters and set their values
mathGenParametersInstructions: There are two options for entering the values for defined parameter(s). The values can be positive, negative and decimal to three places.
mathGenParametersInstructionsList: Value type: List â€” Enter precise numbers you wish to use, separated with a comma.
mathGenParametersInstructionsRange: Value type: Range â€” Set a min and max value for the range. Set a step to increment the final values used.
mathGenQuestionInstructions: Write out your Question stem in the field below. Click the %expressionIcon% button to add your expression in the content or insert your parameter(s) using the %parameterIcon% dropdown selector in the toolbar.
mathGenSummary: There are %possibilities% for this Item. Use the edit button to change the Math Question Generator Expression settings.
mathGenThousandsTooltip: Select a thousands separator. Options are: dot or comma
